The Italian physicist after whom the unit of potential difference is named.
Positively charged subatomic particle.

questions.question: The positive electrode in a cell.
The negative electrode in a cell.
The person who developed the dry cell in 1887.
A number of cells connected in a series.
Cells that can be recharged.
questions.answer: Secondary cells (or storage cells or accumulators)

questions.question: A device that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.
A device that converts solar energy into electrical energy.
A large number of solar cells connected together.
Substances which allow electric current to flow through them easily.
Substances which do not allow electric current to flow through them.
The measure of opposition to current flow in an electrical circuit.
The public supply of electricity for homes and offices.
The type of power plant that uses flowing water to rotate turbines.
The type of power plant that uses fossil fuels like coal to produce electricity.
The metal container that acts as negative electrode in a dry cell.
The rod at the centre of a dry cell that acts as positive electrode.
The chemical paste used as electrolyte in a dry cell (contains ammonium chloride).
questions.answer: Moist paste of ammonium chloride and plaster of Paris

questions.question: The compound that surrounds the carbon rod in a dry cell (acts as depolarizer).
The component that helps in making and breaking of the circuit.
The component that keeps a circuit open or closed for longer duration.
The convenient way to show the path of electric current on paper using symbols.
The safety device that contains a thin wire which melts during overcurrent.
questions.source_section: Prepping for PISA - Fuse vs MCB

questions.question: The automatic safety device more sensitive than fuse that can be reset after tripping.
questions.source_section: Prepping for PISA - Fuse vs MCB

questions.question: The mark on electrical appliances that indicates they meet safety standards.
The insulator that should be stood upon while doing electrical work.
The material used to cover naked electric wires for safety.
A device used to operate devices like clocks, calculators, mobile phones and cameras.
The type of circuit where voltage is shared among all appliances.
The type of circuit where each appliance gets the original voltage.
The direction of current flow that goes from positive to negative terminal.
A machine that uses wind energy to generate electricity by rotating blades.
